page.title: 06FOXES NE Sutton Coldfield
page.content: Foxes are to be found in numerous places all over the housing areas of the block. They have adapted from being forced out of their natural homes when houses were built between and after the world wars. They are seen mostly at night around dustbins but can often be found sleeping under trees near houses in the daytime. It is not uncommon for them to be seen walking boldly down suburban streets. At night they can be heard calling to each other by barking like dogs. One family has been seen digging holes to make a home in the railway embankment beside St.Joseph's R.C. Combined School in the SW corner of the block. They were not even distracted by the numbers of children and parents who stood watching them.
